result.execSummary:
The defendant Manuel A Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed. 

No bars, taverns, liquor stores, beer tents.
Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office. 

Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  

AODA and follow up.  

DNA sample if not already on file.

timeConds.notes: I&S MCJ to be used for rules violations

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Manuel A Williams

records.addlTxt: Re: Order and Amendment to Judgment of Conviction in Probation Cases
Petition and Stipulation to Amend Judgment of Conviction Probation Cases
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Amy. 
Case called:  2:46 p.m. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. 
Defendant appears in person with Attorney Julie Lennon. 

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

PLEA to Count 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine)>>>GUILTY.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 1 year probation. 
CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two.  Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed. No bars, taverns, liquor stores, beer tents.   AODA and follow up.  30 days MCJ I/S to be used for rules violations.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge, if not already on file.  

Adj:  2:57 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 20, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

2:13 PM 
Clerk: Amy. 

State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen.   Defendant appears in custody by video from MCJ with Atty Peter Vu and Krista Cannon.  
COURT grants request under Supreme Court Rule 50 and allows Krista Cannon to appear on behalf of defendant. 

Date and time set for initial appearance. 
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 

COURT ORDERS: $5,000.00 signature bond.  

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with co-defts; Kimberly McFarland, Glenn Reed and Vonzell Williams. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except valid prescriptions taken as prescribed.  
- No possession of drug paraphernalia. 
- Prints and photograph. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 2 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
